abstract: Even as the United States investigates huge advisory fees the Japanese company Olympus paid to a tiny firm with links to the Cayman Islands, a second set of deals that caused Olympus to lose hundreds of millions of dollars is drawing scrutiny in Japan, Hiroko Tabuchi of The New York Times writes.
